title: Why do the feeders start to flame the carries??????
body: I  was xayah carrying pretty hard 75% kill participation no deaths and then my 0-5 ekko speaks up and he says WEHRES MY GANK THIS TEAM FFS IM GETTING CAMPED, i reply with Ward he replies with /all RETARDED XAYAH THINKS I DIDNT WARD REPORTED INTENTING, I reply with if you warded and used the map then you wouldnt of died...., he replies with /all THIS TEAM IS TOO HARD TO CARRY. He goes on to say hes played with me before and i was a trash feeder while i never got a chat restriction and rarely talk as it is because of such non sense, i reply with you the only person feeding here is you, he replies with /all THIS XAYAH IS TRASH, the people i crushed in lane come back with /all Yeah xayah is utter garbage i feel bad for you, it then turned into a 2 man flame on me with the laner i destroyed and my toxic feeding mid laner just harassing me non stop.So i know the course of action i should of taken was swallow the lose swallow the defeat mute all and hope i dont drop 40 lp. But why do the feeders blame the carries when it gets rough.

replies.body:
Everything to dodge personal responsibility. You pointed out a mistake and their ego can't take it.

1. you did well
2. you point out that he is making his own mistakes.
3. in his own mind he is platinum
4. therefore anybody on his team is trash.
5. you offered a suggestion therefore you didn't realize you were trash(in his mind)
6. you get to be his blame for the loss teammate bag

also if an enemy calls you bad it generally means that you are doing great so don't worry, you will probably climb in due time. Sorry this game happened to you.

Meh he started raging like the baby he is, and you actually participated. Why would you even try to reason with him? Of course the other team called you trash too, it's a mind game, and you lost hard. You gotta recognize this shit, or else use the mute button. Mind games is an effective tactic in league of legends. Imagine if you just didn't respond and the ekko didn't get any attention so he just shuts up... that's how it usually goes. Don't take the flame bait.

> [{quoted}](name=Telephone Booth,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=t6BBTW8p,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-06-21T23:46:28.206+0000)
> Mind games is an effective tactic in league of legends. 

He's right you know. If you fall for it, then you'll less likely focused on the match & more focused on what everyone is saying. I actually turned /Allchat off 2 seasons ago because of this & I've noticed I have improved greatly since then. Your best bet is to use the mute buttons given to you & switch all chat off. After that, it's a matter of finding a champion you're good at & just focusing on the task at hand.

Whoever feeds hardest cries loudest, no exceptions.

They think blaming someone else will shift eyes off their own worthlessness.

> [{quoted}](name=MyBackFlipFailed,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=t6BBTW8p,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-06-21T19:53:29.377+0000)
>
> cuz i can

Really? Or is it because you feel insecure about doing badly and don't want to accept the fact that you actually might be responsible for losing?

It seems you only said this to try to upset the OP. Please stop wasting people's time.

It wasn't funny. Please refrain from being an ass to people.

I'm chill, I just don't tolerate people being asses simply for the sake of upsetting others. It's stupid and lame to do so.

You only get one to start with plus one if you buy it.  And if you buy the pink it costs you a pot.  One ward doesn't remotely cover every path to the lane.    Moreover, it's not always possible if you're getting camped because the jungler might just be where you go to ward and the laner will follow you and instead of getting 2 v 1 in lane, you get 2 v 1 where you tried to ward.   So saying "ward" is passive aggressive, dismissive, and condescending.  And all it served to do was make him mad.

So saying "ward" is passive aggressive, dismissive, and condescending.  And all it served to do was make him mad.

While I may agree a single word "ward" CAN be interpreted many different ways, including passive aggressiveness and condescending. But OP followed up with "if you warded and used the map then you wouldn't ~~of ~~ have died" (sorry I had to correct that XD). I think that clearly demonstrated his intention was to provide advice to help rather than being passive aggressive. Perhaps he could have phrased it even better, but Ekko still could have taken it any way he wanted.
